TopicTitle: Just started developing, but need example models to conform to standards!

Articles.Content:
I don't need help modeling, or texturing (I'm terrible at both, but I'll work on it!). But I'd like to develop parts that meet the in-game standards, specifically the aircraft fuselages for now. So are there example or blank MK1 (or is that just a 1.25m circle?), MK2, etc fuselage models that I can start with so I can make sure the ends of my parts conform to these standards? I've tried searching the forum, and I've read all the tutorials, and have got the basics down.

To start, I want to make a MK2 fuselage that contains intakes near the front (off to the sides, so as not to interfere with cockpit mounting), and square wing mounting points near the top of the middle of the fuselage, so those pesky wing edges aren't showing. Possibly want to expand this idea into wings with dedicated landing gear mounting points as well.

If you have Blender, check out taniwha's .mu import/export add-on - you can use it to examine how stock parts are modelled. I myself used it to make a escape tower shroud and heat shield designed to perfectly fit with the stock Mk1-2 Pod.

I am, and that looks perfect for what I need! I just need to line up the front and back edges at least somewhat.

Thank you!
